sentence: Monday headlines include: Salesforce.com launching a new "Wave", a data breach at Kmart, Canadian Pacific Railway approaching CSX about a merger, Boeing getting another big order, and Deutsche Bank losing traders after cracking down on bad behavior.
Cloud-computing firm Salesforce.com ( CRM ) announced a new product called "Wave" on Sunday.
Wave is designed to help Salesforce.com branch out from its core business of customer-relationship management and into other parts of the so-called " big data " market.
Wave allows companies to link data from across business departments into its systems and then creates ways to visualize that data via internet-connected devices.
The Kmart unit of Sears Holdings ( SHLD ) will offer free credit monitoring to customers after a data breach was discovered on Oct. 9.
The company said in an Oct. 10 regulatory filing that the breach happened in early September, and probably exposed payment card information.
Canadian Pacific Railway ( CP ) approached CSX Corp. ( CSX ) about a potential merger but was rebuffed, the Wall Street Journal reported over the weekend.
Such a deal would be subject to a number of regulatory reviews, but would also create a railroad with a market cap of $62 billion.
Aircraft maker Boeing ( BA ) announced an order for 50 737 MAX 8 jets from Garuda Indonesia on Sunday.
The company had already listed the order on its website, but had not yet identified the carrier.
The order involves ordering 46 jets and converting orders for four others to the new fuel-efficient jet.
A recent crackdown on certain behaviors by traders at Deutsche Bank (DB) has lead to the departure of a number of senior bankers .
The Financial Times reported over the weekend that the bank plans to stop its practice of paying bonuses to high-earnings traders if those traders are not seen as team players.

This article was originally published on MarketIntelligenceCenter.com
